page.title: 10Bonfire Night in Chobham
page.content: {Bonfire Night}is celebrated on the 5th November on Chobham Green in Burrow Hill. 1000 people parade through Chobham village of which 300 carry torches. The{torches}are thick pieces of firewood with material soaked in paraffin which is set alight at the appropriate moment. Approximately 10,000 people attend bonfire night. The organisers are Mr James and Mr Robottom.{Fireworks}come in all shapes and sizes from small{sparklers}which you hold in your hand to{rockets}which break up in the air. There is a very large{bonfire}which takes several days to build. The displays of fireworks are colourful, noisy and dazzling to watch. Some people own portable food bars and they bring them along to the occasion. Other people sell luminous necklaces.
